questions_start: ^Oh we visited this place in the 90s. It was kind of surreal being there after everything that had happened, but it was a fascinating trip.
^How old was I in the 90s? I feel like I was young... but I also think we had the kids by then? Ugh, I'm so confused.

b: ^This must be some kind of toy… why would we get a toy as a souvenir?

questions_return: ^Why is this thing rattling? Is it broken?
^What do you mean after everything that happened? What happened?

c-0: ^Some of the most ornate and decadent palaces in the world. You can see why they overthrew the emperor!
c-1: ^No, it’s not broken. There’s more of them inside, they just keep getting smaller and smaller.
c-2: ^You used to teach about this in school: for a long time our countries weren’t friendly, and this entire part of the world was closed off to Americans. Our countries still aren’t too friendly, but it’s a lot better now than it was before.

holdingKnot: ^Okay, I think you should have a pretty good idea of where we got these now. Do you want to guess?
correctAnswer: ^Yes, St. Petersburg! Lots of Americans wanted to visit Russia after the Berlin Wall fell, and there was some pretty spectacular sightseeing. We went in April which might have been a bit of a mistake: it was quite chilly most of our trip.
^Yes, I think it's the farthest North we've ever traveled. Good memory, Honey!

^I remember that itgets colder the farther North you go, but I didn't remember it being cold when we went there. As long as I can make connections like that, maybe I can pass as someone who's not losing their mind.
incorrectAnswer: ^Actually, we got these dolls in St. Petersburg, Russia. We went there after the fall of the Berlin Wall: you said you were always curious to see what it looks like after years of teaching about it, so we went!
^Well, you taught geography, so you taught a lot about the history of Russia and the USSR and how it incorporated so much of Europe and Asia.
^You’d think I’d remember all of this stuff if I was so educated on it, but I can’t. Am I going to lose everything I’ve ever known?
